courseTitle: Independent Study in Special Topics in Education
courseDescription: Independent study of selected topics in education.
Interpersonal and Communication Skills: Collaborating with educators and researchers in the field of education
Organizational and Leadership Skills: Managing independent study timelines in education

courseTitle: Independent Study in Special Topics in Education
courseDescription: Independent study of selected topics in education.
Independent study of special topics in special education.
Technical and Digital Skills: Data collection techniques for special education research
Assistive technology implementation in special education
Statistical analysis in special education research
Interpersonal and Communication Skills: Effective communication with special education students
Collaborating with parents and caregivers of special education students
Presenting research findings in a clear and accessible manner
Problem-Solving and Analytical Skills: Identifying learning challenges in special education students
Developing individualized education plans (IEPs) for special education students
Analyzing data to assess the effectiveness of special education interventions
Organizational and Leadership Skills: Managing time effectively for independent study
Leading discussions on special education research topics
Organizing research materials and data efficiently

courseDescription: The advanced study of selected topics and emergent research related issues that permits small groups of qualified students to study subjects of mutual interest, which, due to their specialized nature, may not be offered regularly.
Independent study of special topics in special education for advanced graduate students.
Technical and Digital Skills: Data analysis in special education research
Interpersonal and Communication Skills: Effective communication with students with special needs
Problem-Solving and Analytical Skills: Analyzing and addressing learning challenges in special education
Organizational and Leadership Skills: Developing and implementing individualized education plans

courseDescription: The advanced study of selected topics and emergent research related issues that permits small groups of qualified students to study subjects of mutual interest, which, due to their specialized nature, may not be offered regularly.
Interpersonal and Communication Skills: Facilitating group discussions on educational topics
Effective presentation of research findings in education
Organizational and Leadership Skills: Collaborating with peers on educational initiatives

courseDescription: This course is a pass/fail course for master's students in their final semester. It may be taken to fulfill the registration requirement necessary for graduation.  All master's students are required to be registered for at least one graduate credit hour in the semester of their graduation.
Interpersonal and Communication Skills: Effective communication with faculty and administration
Organizational and Leadership Skills: Time management for final semester tasks
